DataElement.preferredName: Metastatic Neoplasm Documented Location Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no indicator to ask whether there is documentation of the location of distinct metastases

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to the documented location of distinct neoplastic metastasis.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (MET-uh-STAT-ik) Having to do with metastasis, which is the spread of cancer from one part of the body to another.:(NEE-o-PLAY-zha) Abnormal and uncontrolled cell growth.

Concepts.definition: A term referring to the clinical or pathologic observation of a tumor extension from its original site of growth to another anatomic site.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Property.preferredDefinition: Documented; furnished with or supported by documents.:A position, site, or point in space where something can be found.

Concepts.definition: Furnished with or supported by documents and documentation.
A position, site, or point in space where something can be found.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Are there 2 radiographically
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are there 2 radiographically distinct metastases that are anatomically close(i.e.,with less than or equal to 5cm of normal tissue between them)?
